title: Advanced Cognitive Therapy
headline: Learn about advanced cognitive therapy and research into the intensity of associated anxiety in this free online course.
description: We explain the direction of current cognitive theory and examine the elements of complete situational analysis. We supply information concerning various attributes and uses of perceived autonomic arousal (which often manifest as ‘panic attacks’). We research information about deliberate safety-seeking behaviour. This course examines methods like cognitive assessment and case formulation and explains how to create a help plan.
courseDescription:
During this course, you will evaluate the advanced study of cognitive therapy and the research into the intensity of associated anxiety, presenting you with facts, concepts and terminology. We explain and define the elements of complete situational analysis and guide you through the process of dealing with perceived autonomic arousal. You will know answers to questions such as: what are the first apprehensive thoughts or images? How can you research perceived autonomic arousal? What are the benefits of knowing cognitive processing errors? Next, we will discuss deliberate safety-seeking behaviour and help you assess the various ways of applying it in therapy.

The following section will teach you about cognitive assessment and case formulation. You will learn how to correctly use the tools like the threat reappraisal assessment of immediate fear response. We demonstrate how to visualise the secondary reappraisal evaluation. You will discover the distinct focus varieties of appraisals and beliefs and investigate how to strengthen personal efficacy. In addition to this, we explain how to appropriately manage the adaptive value of fear. We will instruct you on properly answering these questions: What is the secondary reappraisal: assessment and formulation? What tools help you evaluate coping abilities? How can you explain the treatment strategies? The course will end with clarifying ‘homework compliance’.

This course will equip you with skills needed to study advanced cognitive therapy and the intensity of associated anxiety. We provide precise and detailed techniques you can apply in your working field. Have you considered developing a better understanding of the advanced study of cognitive therapy and the intensity of associated anxiety? This course is ideal for those in the working therapy field who have patients who would like to increase their knowledge of cognitive therapy (CBT) and the study of anxiety. Start today and you will be well on your way to understanding this complex disorder.
